oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1956-02-11 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from February 11, 1956 (although disc label is dated February 12, 1956, this is likely incorrect). Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ray Price (host/performer - although Little Jimmy Dickens was advertised as the host for this week on the previous show), guest performer Charlie Walker, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, Lew Childre, Del Wood, Minnie Pearl, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ray Price; Rod Brasfield; Charlie Walker; Tommy Jackson; Lew Childre; Del Wood
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Ray Price -- Run Boy (Ray Price) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Ray Price) -- Ray Price introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Ray Price) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Ray Price) -- Ray Price introduces Charlie Walker -- You Can't Get There From Here (Charlie Walker) -- Ray Price introduces Tommy Jackson and Lew Childre -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Lew Childre calls) -- Ray Price talks -- In The Garden (Ray Price) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Ray Price) -- Ray Price introduces Del Wood -- Ain't She Sweet (Del Wood) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Wood, Del; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Jackson, Tommy; Price, Ray, 1926-2013; Walker, Charlie, 1926-2008
